page.title: 03TRANSPORT
page.content: One dual carriageway,the A23;one main road;two secondary roads and a number of smaller roads cross the area. Generally the roads are well kept especially the A23 which is the main London_Brighton route.This is the busiest road with cars making up 57% of the vehicles surveyed.These were evenly split between British & Foreign. Lorries made up 23%,vans 15%,buses/coaches 3%,& motorbikes 2%. Over six hundred vehicles were counted during a one hour period on a weekday Surveys on the smaller roads showed light use mostly by cars. There are two local buses offering a 2 hourly service. The majority of households have one or more cars,most with petrol engines. There are few motorbikes & bicyles.As this is a farming area quite a few farm vehicles were seen.
